intro: Coccocypselum montanum, commonly known as the mountain coccocypselum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, preferring well-drained soils. Coccocypselum montanum is often found in shrubland and open woodland habitats.
